programme.title: Comedy
programme.desc: Comedy shorts about entertainers include ``Beauty Pageant,`` where potential participants are tested; ``Accidental`` finds an orchestra in disarray; in ``Curtain Call,`` an actor finds it hard to get on stage; ``Night Shoot.``.

programme.title: Shorts in Love
programme.desc: Thrillers involving love include ``Constant Treason,`` in which a scientist falls in love with a CIA agent who is on his tail; a woman who loses love looks to get it back in ``The One I Adore.``.

programme.title: Shorts in Love
programme.desc: Romantic shorts about coffee shop crushes include ``Muse,`` in which a young man is infatuated with a beautiful woman in his local coffee shop; ``Lightning`` sees a young man find and try to return a woman's keys.

programme.title: World Cinema
programme.desc: Shorts featuring child perspectives include ``Dreams`` from India, where a boy invites the former president of India to visit his school; ``Water Path`` from Colombia; ``Butterflies`` from France; ``Interior`` from Brazil.

programme.desc: Stories about young girls include ``Rumspringa Prelude,`` where an Amish family's daughter gets a surprise; ``Woo Woo``; ``The Keyhole``; a girl tries to save her family in ``The Extraordinary World of Cecily Blinkstop.``.

programme.title: Problems With Inheritances
programme.desc: A collection of comedy shorts about inheritances. In ``Father, Son And Holy Moses!`` a man must complete his Bar Mitzvah to receive his father's inheritance, and in ``The Big Mess`` a family fight over who is to inherit a fortune.

programme.title: Animation
programme.desc: Animation by Ukrainian filmmakers include ``Prychynna: The Story of Love,`` ``Movement,`` ``I'm Ghost...,`` ``YYCH1,`` ``YYCH2`` and ``Selected History of Western Civilization.``.

programme.desc: Documentaries dealing with changing areas in America; View Park, Calif. in ``There Goes the Neighborhood``; Harlan County, Ky. in ``Shadows of Endurance``; Gonzales, Texas in ``Auction.``.

programme.desc: Sci-fi shorts about survival include ``Subject 16,`` where a man and a woman facing extinction are confronted with choices that will define what being human means; also: ``Lone Lights,`` ``Alone`` and ``Departure.``.

programme.title: Shorts in Love
programme.desc: Presenting love stories about tortured souls. In ``Martin's Hagge,`` a man plagued by a physical manifestation of his anxiety is nudged from his melancholy by a co-worker, and in ``Replay,`` a man's date with a girl takes an unexpected turn.

programme.title: Shorts in Love
programme.desc: In ``Before I Come Back,`` a film director and father must reassess his personal priorities; in ``Tidal,`` a young man must choose to stay in his old life or commit to his pregnant girlfriend.

programme.title: World Cinema
programme.desc: Stories about wild kids include ``We Are the Bulls`` from South Korea, in which a group of boys breaks all the rules to escape everyday life; ``19'35`` from France sees a youth center in upheaval; ``Carga`` from Portugal.

programme.title: Pure Drama
programme.desc: A presentation of dramas dealing with life and death. Included are ``If You Can Hear Me`` where a boy discovers a death by suicide, ``Mayday,`` where friends go flying, and in ``Abstract Furies,`` where a couple is tested following the death of their son.

programme.desc: Powerful drama about desperate mothers and their children; in ``Mariposa,`` a mom does her best to raise her daughter with dignity and provide a roof over their heads; ``Caroline``; ``Del Rio``; ``And the Wind Falls.``.

programme.title: Mrs. Brown
programme.desc: The friendship of a loyal servant, Scotsman John Brown (Billy Connolly), revives the spirits of Britain's widowed Queen Victoria (Judi Dench).

programme.desc: Mrs Bakshi is looking for suitable husbands for her daughters. When the rich single gents Balraj and Darcy visit, the Bakshis have high hopes, but circumstances get in the way of romance.

programme.desc: When the lights in their underground city start to flicker, two youths (Saoirse Ronan, Harry Treadaway) are the only ones who can save their world from darkness.

programme.title: Where Hands Touch
programme.desc: In 1944, a 15-year-old girl, daughter of a white German mother and a black African father, meets a member of the Hitler Youth. They become bound by the realization of the horrors being committed around them.

programme.desc: During a mission to rescue a kidnapped CIA agent, Navy SEALs uncover a worldwide terrorist plot against the U.S.

programme.title: Half Magic
programme.desc: Three women utilize their newly formed sisterhood to battle sexism, bad relationships and low self-esteem. They soon find the secret to ultimate fulfillment by embracing their wild adventures.

programme.desc: An oil explorer (Charles Grodin), a zoologist (Jeff Bridges) and a shipwrecked blonde (Jessica Lange) capture a huge ape leading to a battle atop the World Trade Center.

programme.title: Danica
programme.desc: Racing superstar Danica Patrick reveals herself like never before: as a competitor preparing for her next race, a woman confidently considering when she wants to start a family and a budding mogul carefully considering thinking about her next steps.

programme.title: He Got Game
programme.desc: A convict's (Denzel Washington) freedom depends upon convincing his estranged son (Ray Allen), a basketball star, to attend the governor's alma mater.

programme.title: A Better Life
programme.desc: An illegal immigrant struggles to give his teenage son a better life by working as a gardener in Los Angeles. He soon does whatever it takes to move out of the city and get his boy away from dangerous gangs.

programme.title: Allan Quatermain and the Lost City of Gold
programme.desc: An explorer (Richard Chamberlain), his archaeologist girlfriend (Sharon Stone) and a Zulu warrior (James Earl Jones) find a jungle city.

programme.title: The Warriors
programme.desc: Gang members blamed for the murder of a charismatic street leader are forced to fight their way back to their turf.

programme.title: King Kong
programme.desc: An oil explorer (Charles Grodin), a zoologist (Jeff Bridges) and a shipwrecked blonde (Jessica Lange) capture a huge ape leading to a battle atop the World Trade Center.

programme.title: Reign of Fire
programme.desc: A hotshot American (Matthew McConaughey) and a firefighter (Christian Bale) unite to fight a horde of dragons in post-apocalyptic London.

programme.title: The Legend of Zorro
programme.desc: The masked swordsman (Antonio Banderas) and his wife (Catherine Zeta-Jones) fight a European count (Rufus Sewell) plotting to block California's statehood.

programme.title: King Arthur
programme.desc: Arthur (Clive Owen) and the Knights of the Round Table embark on a rescue mission as Saxon hordes prepare to invade.

programme.title: Sahara
programme.desc: A treasure hunter (Matthew McConaughey) and his sidekick (Steve Zahn) join forces with a doctor (Penélope Cruz) to search for a Confederate ship in Africa.

programme.title: Reign of Fire
programme.desc: A hotshot American (Matthew McConaughey) and a firefighter (Christian Bale) unite to fight a horde of dragons in post-apocalyptic London.

programme.title: World War Z
programme.desc: When a zombie pandemic threatens to destroy humanity, a former United Nations investigator (Brad Pitt) is forced back into service to try to uncover the source of the infection.

programme.title: Big Top Pee-wee
programme.desc: Childlike Pee-wee Herman (Paul Reubens) falls for a circus star (Valeria Golino) whose troupe is stranded on his strange farm.

programme.title: A Madea Christmas
programme.desc: Madea (Tyler Perry) accompanies her niece to the country for a surprise holiday visit with the niece's daughter, but what they find when they arrive prompts Madea to dish out her own brand of Christmas spirit.

programme.title: A Night at the Roxbury
programme.desc: Desperate to meet women and open their own dance club, brainless brothers Steve (Will Ferrell) and Doug Butabi (Chris Kattan) cruise Beverly Hills.

programme.title: Head of State
programme.desc: An alderman (Chris Rock) becomes a presidential candidate and chooses his unsophisticated brother (Bernie Mac) as a running mate.

programme.title: Look Who's Talking
programme.desc: An unwed accountant (Kirstie Alley) gives birth to Mikey, a hip baby who provides sarcastic commentary on events.

programme.title: Jackass Presents: Bad Grandpa
programme.desc: Irving Zisman (Johnny Knoxville) takes his young and impressionable grandson (Jackson Nicoll) on a cross-country trip in which they encounter male strippers, biker-bar patrons and other unsuspecting citizens.

programme.title: Dirty Grandpa
programme.desc: One week before his wedding, an uptight lawyer (Zac Efron) finds himself driving his foulmouthed grandfather (Robert De Niro) to Daytona Beach, Fla., for a wild spring break that includes frat parties, bar fights and an epic night of karaoke.

programme.title: From
programme.desc: Boyd's plan to head off into the forest provokes an unexpected response from Kenny; Jade enlists Jim's help with an experiment; Tabitha makes a chilling discovery that sends her down a unique path searching for answers.

programme.title: Unprotected Sets
programme.desc: There's no topic off the table for Louis Katz as he spins his stories as a globe-trotting comedian into even more comedy gold.

programme.title: Airplane!
programme.desc: A pilot (Robert Hays) afraid to fly follows his stewardess ex-girlfriend (Julie Hagerty) and must take over for the poisoned crew.

programme.title: Elvis Goes There
programme.desc: Elvis Mitchell meets filmmaker Paul Feig in London for a firsthand look at the evolution of his career in film, with the city's elegant style and traditions as a backdrop.

programme.title: The Space Between
programme.desc: A young mailroom worker develops an unlikely friendship with a washed-up rock star after traveling to his home to force him out of his contract.

programme.title: This Is Home: A Refugee Story
programme.desc: Four Syrian families struggle to find their way in America.

programme.title: You're Next
programme.desc: Members of an estranged, upper-class family must pull together to repel home invaders who are disguised in animal masks and trying to kill them.

programme.title: Look Who's Talking
programme.desc: An unwed accountant (Kirstie Alley) gives birth to Mikey, a hip baby who provides sarcastic commentary on events.

programme.title: Jackass Presents: Bad Grandpa
programme.desc: Irving Zisman (Johnny Knoxville) takes his young and impressionable grandson (Jackson Nicoll) on a cross-country trip in which they encounter male strippers, biker-bar patrons and other unsuspecting citizens.

programme.title: Dirty Grandpa
programme.desc: One week before his wedding, an uptight lawyer (Zac Efron) finds himself driving his foulmouthed grandfather (Robert De Niro) to Daytona Beach, Fla., for a wild spring break that includes frat parties, bar fights and an epic night of karaoke.

programme.title: The Woman in Black
programme.desc: A widowed lawyer (Daniel Radcliffe) encounters ghostly goings-on at the foreboding estate of a recently deceased client.

programme.title: After Darkness
programme.desc: As the sun burns out and darkness shrouds the planet, a family must reckon with long-held grudges and heal painful memories from the past.

programme.title: Arrival
programme.desc: A linguistics professor (Amy Adams) leads an elite team of investigators in a race against time to communicate with extraterrestrial visitors.

programme.title: From
programme.desc: Boyd's plan to head off into the forest provokes an unexpected response from Kenny; Jade enlists Jim's help with an experiment; Tabitha makes a chilling discovery that sends her down a unique path searching for answers.

programme.title: Star Trek Into Darkness
programme.desc: After an act of terrorism leaves him with a personal score to settle, Capt. Kirk (Chris Pine) defies Starfleet regulations and leads his crew (Zachary Quinto, Karl Urban) on a mission to capture a powerfully destructive force.

programme.title: Paycheck
programme.desc: After learning that his memory has been erased, a technical wizard (Ben Affleck) goes on the run to piece together clues from his past.

programme.title: Dredd
programme.desc: In a violent, futuristic metropolis, a law-enforcement officer (Karl Urban) and his rookie trainee (Olivia Thirlby) become caught up in a high-stakes conflict with a vicious prostitute-turned-drug lord (Lena Headey).

programme.title: Dickie Roberts: Former Child Star
programme.desc: Hoping to make a comeback, a man (David Spade) stays with a suburban family to prepare for the lead role in a Rob Reiner film.

programme.title: Bernie the Dolphin 2
programme.desc: The kids are thrilled that Bernie has come back. But so has their old enemy Winston, who's about to kidnap the talented dolphin. Kevin and Holly must rescue their splashy friend before it's too late.

programme.title: The Courier
programme.desc: A courier in London discovers that one of the packages she's transporting is a bomb.

programme.title: Case 39
programme.desc: A social worker (Renée Zellweger) saves a girl (Jodelle Ferland) from abusive parents but finds there is more to the child than meets the eye.

programme.title: Star Trek Into Darkness
programme.desc: After an act of terrorism leaves him with a personal score to settle, Capt. Kirk (Chris Pine) defies Starfleet regulations and leads his crew (Zachary Quinto, Karl Urban) on a mission to capture a powerfully destructive force.

programme.title: Paycheck
programme.desc: After learning that his memory has been erased, a technical wizard (Ben Affleck) goes on the run to piece together clues from his past.

programme.title: The Conversation
programme.desc: When a surveillance expert (Gene Hackman) suspects that the subjects of his current job will be killed, his conscience interferes.

programme.title: The Lovely Bones
programme.desc: A 14-year-old murder victim watches from heaven, as her family tries to heal and her killer continues on his own dark path.

programme.title: Panic Room
programme.desc: A single woman (Jodie Foster) and her daughter must play a cat-and-mouse game after three thieves (Forest Whitaker, Dwight Yoakam) invade their New York brownstone.

programme.title: Jack Reacher
programme.desc: A defense attorney (Rosamund Pike) hires an enigmatic ex-Army investigator (Tom Cruise) to tackle the case of a highly trained sniper who apparently murdered five people at random.

programme.title: Kiss the Girls
programme.desc: After escaping from a serial killer, a doctor (Ashley Judd) helps police and a forensic psychologist (Morgan Freeman) track the madman.

programme.title: The Manchurian Candidate
programme.desc: A troubled Gulf War veteran (Denzel Washington) becomes suspicious after a powerful senator's (Meryl Streep) son (Liev Schreiber) becomes a candidate for vice president.

programme.title: The Haunting
programme.desc: A parapsychologist (Liam Neeson) and three others stay in a house reputed to be the site of many awful tragedies.

programme.title: Save the Last Dance 2
programme.desc: A talented dancer (Izabella Miko) falls for a musician (Columbus Short), while embracing traditional ballet and hip-hop.

programme.title: The Tuxedo
programme.desc: A chauffeur (Jackie Chan) embarks on a covert mission after a tuxedo from a secret agent (Jason Isaacs) gives him extraordinary abilities.

programme.title: Swingers
programme.desc: Would-be sultans of coolness help a socially inept friend find romance as they strut through Hollywood and Las Vegas.

programme.title: Hard Rain
programme.desc: A thief (Morgan Freeman), a sheriff (Randy Quaid) and the nephew (Christian Slater) of an armored-truck driver seek money bags in a flooding Indiana town.

programme.title: Snitch
programme.desc: To save his teenage son from an unjust prison sentence, a businessman (Dwayne Johnson) makes a deal with a U.S. attorney to infiltrate a dangerous drug cartel and become an informant.

programme.title: Confessions of a Dangerous Mind
programme.desc: Chuck Barris (Sam Rockwell) produces game shows for television and leads a double life as a CIA assassin.

programme.title: Dragon Blade
programme.desc: An exiled Chinese general (Jackie Chan) offers shelter to a renegade Roman (John Cusack) and his legion, then becomes involved in the soldier's dispute with Rome's villainous consul (Adrien Brody).

programme.title: The Counselor
programme.desc: A successful lawyer (Michael Fassbender) gets in over his head when he decides to dabble in the drug trade.

programme.title: Hellraiser: Hellworld
programme.desc: Gamers who participate in an online role-playing game (MMORPG) are invited to a rave whose host plans to show them all the truth behind the Cenobite mythos.

programme.title: Si
programme.desc: A day in the life of a young Asian-American.

programme.title: Save the Last Dance 2
programme.desc: A talented dancer (Izabella Miko) falls for a musician (Columbus Short), while embracing traditional ballet and hip-hop.

programme.title: A Guy Thing
programme.desc: After his bachelor party, a man (Jason Lee) wakes up in bed with his fiancee's (Selma Blair) cousin (Julia Stiles), a dancer at the bash.

programme.title: Universal Soldier
programme.desc: Dead soldiers from the '60s surface in the '90s as high-tech warriors (Jean-Claude Van Damme, Dolph Lundgren) reanimated by the U.S. government.

programme.title: Rocky
programme.desc: Heavyweight champ Apollo Creed gives Philadelphia club fighter Rocky Balboa (Sylvester Stallone) a title shot.

programme.title: The Uninvited
programme.desc: A ghost prompts a lethal battle of wills between a man's new fiancee (Elizabeth Banks) and his two daughters (Emily Browning, Arielle Kebbel), one of whom has just returned from a mental ward.

programme.title: Oblivion
programme.desc: Two weeks before he is scheduled to depart from devastated planet Earth forever, a drone repairman (Tom Cruise) rescues a woman (Olga Kurylenko) from a downed spaceship, triggering a final battle to save mankind.

programme.title: The Great Gatsby
programme.desc: A writer (Tobey Maguire) gets swept up in the affairs of Jazz Age New York's wealthy elite when he moves next-door to a mysterious millionaire (Leonardo DiCaprio) who throws lavish parties and pines for an unattainable woman (Carey Mulligan).

programme.title: Bandits
programme.desc: Two bank robbers (Bruce Willis, Billy Bob Thornton) fall for a bored housewife (Cate Blanchett) who helps them commit heists across the country.

programme.title: The Legend of Hercules
programme.desc: Exiled and sold into slavery because of a forbidden love, Hercules (Kellan Lutz) must use his formidable powers to fight his way back to his rightful kingdom.

programme.title: Mimic
programme.desc: Married scientists (Mira Sorvino, Jeremy Northam) battle killer cockroaches that develop the ability to assume human form.

programme.title: Body Brokers
programme.desc: Brought to Los Angeles for treatment, a recovering junkie soon learns that the rehab center is not about helping people -- it's merely a cover for a multibillion dollar fraud operation that enlists addicts to recruit other addicts.

programme.title: The Aviator
programme.desc: During the 1930s and '40s, wealthy industrialist Howard Hughes (Leonardo DiCaprio) gains fame as a movie producer, airplane designer and pilot.

programme.title: Brothers by Blood
programme.desc: A man remains tormented by his sister's death, while his cousin grows more powerful in the hierarchy of the family crime business.

programme.title: Frailty
programme.desc: A boy tries to protect his brother after their seemingly normal father (Bill Paxton) goes on a killing spree.

programme.title: Fast Company
programme.desc: After his sponsor replaces him with his archrival, a race-car driver decides to steal the car and race it himself.

programme.title: The Faculty
programme.desc: High-school students (Jordana Brewster, Clea DuVall, Laura Harris) gradually begin to suspect that their teachers are from another planet.

programme.title: Darkness Falls
programme.desc: The spirit of a woman who was lynched more than 150 years earlier haunts residents (Emma Caulfield, Lee Cormie) of a New England town.

programme.title: Black Nativity
programme.desc: A street-wise teen discovers the value of faith, healing and family after he goes to New York to spend Christmas with his estranged relatives (Forest Whitaker, Angela Bassett).

programme.title: The Amityville Horror
programme.desc: Strange events take place after a family (Ryan Reynolds, Melissa George, Jesse James) moves into a new house that was the site of several gruesome murders.

programme.title: Runner Runner
programme.desc: A Princeton grad student (Justin Timberlake) becomes the protege of an online-gambling tycoon (Ben Affleck) whose shady dealings have attracted the attention of the FBI.

programme.title: Blood Father
programme.desc: An ex-convict (Mel Gibson) and his estranged daughter (Erin Moriarty) go on the run from her drug-dealing boyfriend (Diego Luna) and his vicious cartel.

programme.title: Basic Instinct
programme.desc: An erotic writer (Sharon Stone) toys with a San Francisco detective (Michael Douglas) who thinks she might be an ice-pick killer.

programme.title: Twisted
programme.desc: With help from her partner (Andy Garcia), a police inspector (Ashley Judd) searches for a killer who is murdering her former lovers.

programme.title: The Order
programme.desc: A priest (Heath Ledger) meets an immortal (Benno Fürmann) who can offer absolution to confessors by swallowing their sins.

programme.title: Larry Crowne
programme.desc: Unemployed after a round of corporate downsizing, a middle-aged man (Tom Hanks) enrolls in college and meets a teacher (Julia Roberts) who has lost her passion for her job and her husband.

programme.title: Cinderella Man
programme.desc: Despite a string of losses and injuries, boxer Jim Braddock (Russell Crowe) makes a dramatic comeback and faces champion Max Baer.

programme.title: The High Note
programme.desc: Maggie is the overworked personal assistant to Grace Davis, a superstar singer whose talent and ego have reached unbelievable heights. Stuck running errands, Maggie still wants to fulfill her childhood dream of becoming a music producer. But when Grace's manager presents her with a choice that could alter the course of her career, Maggie and Grace come up with a plan that could change both of their lives forever.

programme.title: How to Deal
programme.desc: For teenager Halley (Mandy Moore), love seems like an alien concept. Her mother, Lydia (Allison Janney), and father, Len (Peter Gallagher), are divorced. Lydia doesn't date, and Len is now seeing a younger woman. Halley's sister, Ashley (Mary Catherine Garrison), is about to get married and doesn't realize that her fiancé (Mackenzie Astin) is not the man of her dreams. But, when Halley meets edgy Macon (Trent Ford), she learns what love is really all about.

programme.title: What Women Want
programme.desc: Nick Marshall (Mel Gibson) gets a whole new outlook on life when a fluke accident gives him the ability to read women's minds. At first, this "gift" provides Nick with way too much information, but he begins to realize that he can use it to good effect, especially when it comes to outwitting his new boss, Darcy Maguire (Helen Hunt).

programme.title: Thirteen
programme.desc: Honor student Tracy Freeland (Evan Rachel Wood) has a troubling home life, but she is close to her mother, Melanie (Holly Hunter). While trying to conceal her inner turmoil by excelling academically, she befriends the calculating Evie (Nikki Reed), her school's queen bee. Evie talks Tracy into experimenting with drugs, exploring her sexuality and pickpocketing strangers to finance shopping sprees -- but before long, Melanie realizes she must step in and stop her daughter's destructive lifestyle.

programme.title: Baggage Claim
programme.desc: Although she has traveled all over the world, flight attendant Montana Moore (Paula Patton) has yet to find a man with whom she wants to settle down. However, her sister's upcoming wedding and pressure from her often-married mother force her to calculate that she has a month to find a fiance of her own. Montana's best friends and fellow flight attendants conspire to help her re-encounter her exes as they travel across the country, but the right man may be closer than she thinks.

programme.title: The World's End
programme.desc: Gary King (Simon Pegg) is an immature 40-year-old who's dying to take another stab at an epic pub-crawl that he last attempted 20 years earlier. He drags his reluctant buddies back to their hometown and sets out for a night of heavy drinking. As they make their way toward their ultimate destination -- the fabled World's End pub -- Gary and his friends attempt to reconcile the past and present. However, the real struggle is for the future when their journey turns into a battle for mankind.

programme.title: Escape Plan
programme.desc: Tough and chiseled Ray Breslin (Sylvester Stallone) knows how to infiltrate a prison -- and bust out of one. His latest job leads to a double-cross, leaving him stuck in a high-tech facility with the worst that society has to offer. Luckily for Ray, he meets Emil Rottmayer (Arnold Schwarzenegger), an inmate who secretly helps him hatch a plot to win his freedom. Only sadistic warden Hobbes (Jim Caviezel) stands in the way of the two men successfully making it out alive.

programme.title: The 40-Year-Old Virgin
programme.desc: Andy Stitzer (Steve Carell) is an amiable single guy who works at a big-box store. Living alone, 40-year-old Andy spends his free time playing video games and curating his action-figure collection. Despite his age, Andy has never had sex, so his friends, including the laid-back David (Paul Rudd), push Andy towards losing his virginity. While attempting to get over his awkwardness around female customers, Andy meets local shop owner Trish (Catherine Keener), and they begin a tentative romance.

programme.title: Hellraiser: Hellseeker
programme.desc: A shady businessman attempts to piece together the details of the car crash that killed his wife, rendered him an amnesiac, and left him in possession of a sinister puzzle box that summons monsters.

programme.title: Colors
programme.desc: In this gritty police drama from director Dennis Hopper, street-wise cop Bob Hodges (Robert Duvall) and hotheaded rookie Danny McGavin (Sean Penn) grapple with their new partnership on the gang-ridden streets of Los Angeles. Although Danny finally lets Hodges show him the ropes, his adrenaline-fed brutality earns him a reputation with the very gangs they want to help. With a gang war ready to explode, Danny confronts his own racism even as he falls in love with Louisa (Maria Conchita Alonso).

programme.title: Ghost Town
programme.desc: After a near-death experience during a routine colonoscopy, people-hating dentist Bertrum Pincus is shocked to discover that he is suddenly able to talk to the dead. Constantly cornered by unhappy spirits who want him to help resolve their earthly problems, the misanthropic Pincus is driven to distraction. Eventually talked into helping the dearly departed Frank Herlihy, Pincus attempts to talk to Frank's widow, Gwen.

programme.title: My Cousin Vinny
programme.desc: New York lawyer Vinny has never won a case. When his teenage cousin Bill and his friend Stan are accused of murder in a backwater Alabama town, it's up to the nervous Vinny to save him from jail, even though he's only ever tried personal injury cases before, and none of them successfully.

programme.title: Rocky Balboa
programme.desc: Now long-retired, Rocky (Sylvester Stallone) runs a Philadelphia eatery and mourns the loss of his beloved wife, Adrian. Yearning to recapture a bit of his glory days, he plans to re-enter the ring for a few low-profile, local matches. All that changes when Rocky accepts a challenge to fight the world's reigning heavyweight champion, Mason "the Line" Dixon (Antonio Tarver).

programme.title: Taken 2
programme.desc: Two years ago, retired CIA agent Bryan Mills (Liam Neeson) used his "particular set of skills" to rescue his daughter, Kim (Maggie Grace), from kidnappers. Since then, Kim has been learning self-defense from her father, and Bryan has been on a personal mission to reunite with his ex-wife (Famke Janssen). In Istanbul, Bryan and his family cross paths with Murad (Rade Serbedzija), whose son died at Bryan's hand during Kim's rescue. Murad wants revenge, and he'll stop at nothing to get it.

programme.title: A Rodeo Film
programme.desc: A bull rider has an affair with his brother's wife.

programme.title: 2 Guns
programme.desc: For the past year, DEA agent Bobby Trench (Denzel Washington) and U.S. Navy intelligence officer Marcus Stigman (Mark Wahlberg) have been working under cover as members of a narcotics syndicate. The twist: Neither man knows that the other is an undercover agent. When their attempt to infiltrate a Mexican drug cartel and recover millions goes haywire, the men are disavowed by their superiors. Trench and Stigman must go on the run lest they wind up in jail or in a grave.

programme.title: Irresistible
programme.desc: A Democratic political consultant helps a retired Marine colonel run for mayor in a small Wisconsin town.

programme.title: Against the Ropes
programme.desc: Boxing manager Jackie Kallen (Meg Ryan) believes she and a veteran trainer can turn a young man (Omar Epps) into a streamlined prizefighter.

programme.title: A Simple Plan
programme.desc: While in the woods near their small town, upstanding local Hank Mitchell (Bill Paxton), his dim brother Jacob (Billy Bob Thornton) and their friend Lou (Brent Briscoe) discover a crashed plane with two things in it -- a dead pilot, and a stash of more than four million dollars. Although Hank is reluctant to keep the money, Jacob and Lou convince him otherwise, and they devise a plan to split the fortune. Things quickly go wrong, however, dramatically affecting the trio and those around them.

programme.title: Employee of the Month
programme.desc: Zack (Dane Cook) and Vince (Dax Shepard) are rival co-workers at Super Club, the country's largest bulk-discount retailer but, while Vince is on the fast-track at Super Club, Zack's laid-back approach to work holds him back. That all changes when a new cashier, named Amy (Jessica Simpson), transfers to their store. Zack is instantly smitten, but Amy prefers Vince. Zack determines that the only way to win her is to win his store's most coveted honor.

programme.title: Identity Thief
programme.desc: Florida resident Diana (Melissa McCarthy) has a luxurious lifestyle as the queen of retail, buying whatever strikes her fancy -- and it's all free, thanks to Sandy Patterson (Jason Bateman), a guy from Denver whose identity she stole. With just one week to track down Diana before his world implodes, the real Sandy heads south to confront the unapologetic con artist and bring her back to Denver so that he can clear his name and restore his shattered credit rating.

programme.title: The Snowman
programme.desc: For Detective Harry Hole, the death of a young woman during the first snowfall of winter feels like anything but a routine homicide. His investigation leads him to "The Snowman Killer," an elusive sociopath who continuously taunts Hole with cat-and-mouse games. As the vicious murders continue, Harry teams up with a brilliant recruit to try and lure the madman out of the shadows before he can strike again.

programme.title: Reasonable Doubt
programme.desc: A prosecutor (Dominic Cooper) commits a fatal hit-and-run, then manipulates the case so that the man who was arrested for the crime is acquitted. After the trial, he discovers that his actions have freed a guilty man.

programme.title: Vanilla Sky
programme.desc: Tom Cruise and Cameron Crowe reunite after "Jerry Maguire" for "Vanilla Sky," the story of a young New York City publishing magnate who finds himself on an unexpected roller-coaster ride of romance, comedy, suspicion, love, sex and dreams in a mind-bending search for his soul.

programme.title: Dirty Rotten Scoundrels
programme.desc: Con artist Lawrence Jamieson (Michael Caine) is a longtime resident of a luxurious coastal resort, where he enjoys the fruits of his deceptions -- that is, until a competitor, Freddy Benson (Steve Martin), shows up. When the new guy's lowbrow tactics impinge on his own work, Jamieson resolves to get rid of him. Confident of his own duplicitous talents, Jamieson challenges Benson to a winner-takes-all competition: whoever swindles their latest mark first can stay, while the other must leave town.

programme.title: The Witches of Eastwick
programme.desc: Three small-town friends, Alexandra (Cher), Jane (Susan Sarandon) and Sukie (Michelle Pfeiffer), each having lost the man in their lives, are feeling unfulfilled -- until a furtive stranger, Daryl Van Horne (Jack Nicholson), arrives and begins courting each of them in turn. Eventually, Daryl tells them that they are witches. But as the three friends spend more time at his mansion, enjoying themselves and learning about their powers, they begin to worry about Daryl's ultimate intentions.

programme.title: Igby Goes Down
programme.desc: Igby Slocumb (Kieran Culkin), a rebellious and sarcastic 17-year-old boy, is at war with the stifling world of old money privilege he was born into. With a schizophrenic father (Bill Pullman), a self-absorbed, distant mother (Susan Sarandon), and a shark-like young Republican big brother (Ryan Phillippe), Igby figures there must be a better life out there -- and sets about finding it.

programme.title: Murder in the First
programme.desc: Henry, a small-time criminal sent to Alcatraz, is caught attempting to escape and as punishment, he's put in solitary confinement. Instead of staying the maximum nineteen days, he is kept alone, in the cold and complete darkness for years, only to emerge a madman and a murderer. It's a rookie lawyer who proves Alcatraz is to blame, and that Henry should not be executed.

programme.title: Broadcast News
programme.desc: Intelligent satire of American television news. A highly strung news producer finds herself strangely attracted to a vapid anchorman even through she loathes everything he personifies. To make matters worse, her best friend, a talented but not particularly telegenic news reporter, is secretly in love with her.

programme.title: Repentance
programme.desc: A disturbed client (Forest Whitaker) uses torture to coerce a self-help author (Anthony Mackie) into confessing his untold crimes.

programme.title: Babylon A.D.
programme.desc: In a post-apocalyptic wasteland, a battle-hardened mercenary, Toorop (Vin Diesel), lives by his own code and the credo kill or be killed. His latest assignment is to escort a young woman named Aurora (Mélanie Thierry) and her guardian, Sister Rebeka (Michelle Yeoh), from Kazakhstan to New York. Facing danger at each turn, Toorop begins to realize that Aurora represents the last hope for mankind's survival.

programme.title: 28 Weeks Later
programme.desc: Six months after the original epidemic, the rage virus has all but annihilated the population of the British Isles. Nevertheless the U.S. Army declares the danger past, and American soldiers arrive to restore order and begin reconstruction. Refugees return to British soil, but one of them carries a deadly secret: The virus is not gone and is even more dangerous than before.

programme.title: Hangman
programme.desc: A detective and a criminal profiler pursue a serial killer whose crimes are inspired by a children's game called hangman.

programme.title: Fatale
programme.desc: After a wild one-night stand, a successful sports agent watches his perfect life slowly disappear when he discovers the sexy and mysterious woman he risked everything for is a determined police detective who entangles him in her latest investigation. As he desperately tries to put the pieces together, he falls deeper into her trap, risking his family, his career, and even his life.

programme.title: Fatal Attraction

programme.title: CSI: New York
programme.desc: The third permutation of the "CSI" franchise sets up shop in the Big Apple, where taciturn detective Mac Taylor and his new partner, Jo Danville, lead a crime-solving team. Taylor, a retired Marine who believes evidence holds the truth that people may try to cover up, finds balance in Jo's empathy-driven investigative style. Their team includes spirited investigators like Danny Messer and wife Lindsay Monroe Messer, former coroner Sheldon Hawkes, and edgy detective Don Flack.

programme.desc: With the help of a neighbor, an injured woman calls 911 saying an intruder broke into her boyfriend's home and shot them both; police respond to find the boyfriend executed; they must decipher strange evidence left behind to identify the killer.

programme.title: Murder Calls
programme.desc: Two girls disappear from neighboring counties, and they are later found murdered; one family receives multiple taunting calls from the killer; investigators work to track him down and succeed after discovering a clue delivered by the killer himself.

programme.title: Murder Calls

programme.title: See No Evil
programme.desc: A quiet town is shaken to its core when an innocent woman is gunned down in broad daylight; detectives desperately act to find her killer and restore the peace.

programme.desc: A Seattle woman is brutally murdered close to a homeless encampment.

programme.title: Web of Lies

programme.sub-title: The Suspicious Death of Christian Andreacchio

programme.title: Your Worst Nightmare

programme.title: Your Worst Nightmare
programme.desc: With a new home and loving fiancé, single mother Lisa Filiaggi finally feels as though luck is on her side, then past troubles come back to haunt her and threaten to destroy all her future plans.

programme.title: Your Worst Nightmare
programme.desc: Frankie Cochran falls for handsome David Gehrard, then his behavior begins to alarm Cochran, making her wonder if a secret from Gehrard's past holds more meaning than she thought.

programme.title: A Time to Kill
programme.desc: Menachem Stark enjoys life as a respected businessman and father to seven children; in 2014, his wife calls police when he fails to return home, and a subsequent search leads to a dark secret.

programme.title: A Time to Kill
programme.desc: After being stabbed at his Marietta, Ga., home, beloved son Mitchell Jones dies at the hospital; Mitchell is a popular gay man, so police have several potential suspects; it isn't until they employ a new tracking tool that the case breaks wide open.

programme.title: A Time to Kill
programme.desc: Divorced soccer mom Paige Birgfeld's disappearance catapults her ex-husbands to the top of the suspect list, but when one of them provides a tantalizing clue about Paige's risky secret life, the number of potential culprits explodes.

programme.title: The Perfect Murder
programme.desc: Multi-millionaire Las Vegas real estate developer Ron Rudin goes missing; to find him, detectives trace twisted a path filled with haunting spirits, dark obsession and greed.

programme.title: The Perfect Murder
programme.desc: Hollywood golden boy Gavin Smith, a 20th Century Fox executive and former star UCLA basketball player, goes missing; for years, his family and detectives search tirelessly for answers, but a group of heartless characters hold fast to their secrets.

programme.title: Deadly Recall
programme.desc: While investigating two separate homicide cases, Detective Pat Postiglione discovers that the same psychotic killer is behind all the murders and has a unique calling card.

programme.title: Deadly Recall
programme.desc: When the remains of a young mother are discovered in a remote area outside Nashville, Tenn., Detective Postiglione solves the crime by recalling a detail from the wooded scene and puts a dangerous murderer behind bars.

programme.title: Diabolical
programme.desc: In Garden Grove, Calif., 19-year-old Jose Najera sneaks out of his parents' house to attend a late-night party, then he returns home to find both parents dead on their bedroom floor.

programme.title: The Body on the Beach
programme.desc: When a pregnant woman disappears after attending a prenatal yoga class, a marriage is put under a microscope (New!).

programme.desc: Complaints about dogs running loose lead to the construction of a fence between two long-time neighbors, but the problem isn't solved and flaring tempers lead to fist fights, stabbings, and ultimately a shocking shootout captured on video.

programme.title: The Killer Beside Me
programme.desc: A Virginia Beach massage therapist disappears before work, sparking an intense search; weeks later, a cyclist discovers trash bags in a swamp.

programme.title: The Killer Beside Me

programme.title: The Killer Beside Me
programme.desc: A retail store employee's crush on manager Antoinette Venditti Bruce escalates into an obsession after he's fired for inappropriate behavior; she is transferred out of state for work and the stalker tracks her down to carry out his twisted plans.

programme.title: Home Alone
programme.desc: In Alabama, teenager Haley craves her independence, but her protective mother, Teresa, worries about the company she's keeping; Teresa convinces Haley to end a toxic relationship with a young man, but he won't let go until he gets what he wants.

programme.title: Home Alone
programme.desc: Sophia Putney-Wilcox is excited to start her senior year of high school after ending an abusive relationship with her boyfriend, Adam; unable to take the rejection, Adam breaks into her house with a bottle of gasoline and a lighter.

programme.title: Home Alone
programme.desc: In November 2009, Yei and John Daniels come home to find their house ransacked; a few days later, after enjoying the Christmas of a lifetime, a knock at the door changes their lives forever.

programme.title: Nightmare Next Door
programme.sub-title: Dear Katherine, It's Me the Killer
programme.desc: When 18-year-old college freshman Katherine Foster goes missing, rumors fly as fellow students at the University of South Alabama fear the worst.

programme.desc: In Rock Hill, S.C., former homecoming queen Melinda Snyder's murder embroils the town in a mystery that won't be settled until the South Carolina Supreme Court weighs in.

programme.title: Nightmare Next Door
programme.desc: Jimmy McClain is a teacher and coach at a Tennessee high school, then he is found assassinated in his home, and police must contend with a laundry list of suspects.

programme.title: Fear Thy Neighbor
programme.desc: A family loves everything about their new home except the mockingbirds that perch and squawk in the backyard lemon tree; the family seeks to scare them off, igniting a feud with their neighbors that spins out of control until someone lies dead.

programme.title: Fear Thy Neighbor
programme.desc: Living in her family home, a woman befriends her new neighbors, only to be plunged into a nightmare of threats, violence and betrayal; after her brother steps up to protect her, blood will be spilled and lives forever shattered.

programme.title: Fear Thy Neighbor
programme.desc: A single woman and her daughter are delighted when a single man and his two daughters move in next door; they become fast friends until molestation charges result in anger, accusations and multiple bloody deaths.

programme.title: Your Worst Nightmare
programme.desc: Dancer Jodi Sanderholm spends weeks practicing for her team's big performance, then vanishes hours before the event, which doesn't make sense until a friend comes forward with strange details about the days leading up to Jodi's disappearance.

programme.title: Your Worst Nightmare
programme.desc: After college graduate Anita Wooldridge goes missing from her parents' home, investigators must rely on quick thinking and cunning police work, as they race against the clock to find her before it's too late.

programme.title: Your Worst Nightmare
programme.desc: Single mom Carrie Caudill and a friend embark on a girl's night out, but an unexpected confrontation puts Carrie on a dangerous collision course with a sadistic madman.

programme.title: Your Worst Nightmare
programme.desc: Despite her family's protests, 19-year-old Micah Rine marries Thomas Pate and moves away with him; when Thomas reports Micah missing after she fails to return home from a run, investigators take a close look at their life together in Tennessee.

programme.title: Evil Lives Here
programme.desc: Ronald and Patty had always seen the signs that their older brother, Bernard Eugene Giles, had a darker side, but when Gene finally let loose the monster lurking inside, they couldn't help but wonder how things had gone so wrong.

programme.title: Evil Lives Here
programme.desc: Teenager Sarah Garone is targeted by an anonymous predator for nearly a decade; each time, Sarah turns to her stepfather, Gary Hardy, for protection, not realizing he is the one determined to hurt her.

programme.title: Evil Lives Here
programme.desc: A woman believes that her sister blames her for the crimes she committed.

programme.title: I (Almost) Got Away With It: Confessions
programme.desc: After making millions smuggling pot across the U.S. border, a multinational drug operation goes down in one of the biggest busts in history; a jailbird makes one last attempt at freedom in a series of botched robberies and high-speed chases (New!).

programme.title: Evil Lives Here
programme.desc: Shelly Lietz has been afraid of her son ever since he was four years old, and her fear intensifies and grows more crippling as he gets older and more violent, turning her into a prisoner in her own home.

programme.title: Evil Lives Here
programme.desc: Alice Swanson envies her childhood neighbor William Jennings Choyce for his perfect life, then she marries him and realizes his life wasn't perfect below the surface.

programme.title: Belushi
programme.desc: Jim Belushi, Chevy Chase, Dan Aykroyd and others discuss the extraordinary life and career of beloved actor and comedian John Belushi.

programme.title: Safe Haven
programme.desc: Katie Feldman (Julianne Hough) moves to a small town on the North Carolina coast, determined to make a new life for herself. She takes a job as a waitress and keeps a low profile, but she is soon won over by the warmth and caring of the close-knit community, especially that of widower Alex (Josh Duhamel). With the help of Alex and his children, Katie learns to love and trust again -- but when a mysterious stranger arrives and starts asking questions, Katie's dark past threatens to reclaim her.

programme.title: Spy Kids
programme.desc: Two young kids become spies in attempt to save their parents, who are ex-spies, from an evil mastermind. Armed with a bag of high tech gadgets and out-of-this world transportation, Carmen (Alexa Vega) and Juni (Daryl Sabara) will bravely jet through the air, dive under the seas and crisscross the globe in a series of thrilling adventures on a mission to save their parents ... and maybe even the world.

programme.title: After Yang
programme.desc: When his young daughter's beloved companion -- an android named Yang -- malfunctions, Jake searches for a way to repair it. In the process, Jake discovers the life that has been passing in front of him as he reconnects with his wife and daughter.

programme.title: Failure to Launch
programme.desc: A young man (Matthew McConaughey) continues to live at the home of parents who, in desperation to push him out of the nest once and for all, hatch a plan. They hire a beautiful woman (Sarah Jessica Parker) to entice him to assume the mantle of responsibility and get his own place.

programme.title: Pulp Fiction
programme.desc: Vincent Vega (John Travolta) and Jules Winnfield (Samuel L. Jackson) are hitmen with a penchant for philosophical discussions. In this ultra-hip, multi-strand crime movie, their storyline is interwoven with those of their boss, gangster Marsellus Wallace (Ving Rhames) ; his actress wife, Mia (Uma Thurman) ; struggling boxer Butch Coolidge (Bruce Willis) ; master fixer Winston Wolfe (Harvey Keitel) and a nervous pair of armed robbers, "Pumpkin" (Tim Roth) and "Honey Bunny" (Amanda Plummer).

programme.title: Deadlock
programme.desc: Wanted criminal Ron Whitlock leads a rogue team of mercenaries on a mission of vengeance. Convinced that the government is working against them, the merciless group brutally seizes an energy plant and holds everyone inside hostage. With a nearby town on the brink of massive flooding and destruction, it's up to a retired Army ranger to save thousands of innocent lives before it's too late.

programme.title: Cinema Toast
programme.sub-title: One Gay Wedding and a Thousand Funerals
programme.desc: After gay marriage is legalized, one man in a small town is determined that the only logical response is to convince the straight men and women to throw themselves off a tall ladder in protest.

programme.title: Cinema Toast
programme.desc: A riff on film noir via a fever dream landscape that folds in and out of narratives and a series of flashbacks, meticulously and abstractly threaded together by three protagonists.

programme.title: Mid90s
programme.desc: In 1990s Los Angeles, a 13-year-old spends his summer navigating between a troubled home life and a crew of new friends he meets at a skate shop.

programme.title: The Monster
programme.desc: A divorced mother and her headstrong daughter must make an emergency late-night road trip to see the girl's father. As they drive through deserted country roads on a stormy night, they suddenly have a startling collision that leaves them shaken but not seriously hurt. Their car, however, is dead, and as they try in vain to get help, they come to realize they are not alone -- a terrifying evil is lurking in the woods, intent on never letting them leave.

programme.title: Queen of the Morning Calm
programme.desc: An abused sex worker tries to make a better life for herself and her young daughter.

programme.title: Saving Flora
programme.desc: Flora is a circus elephant who can no longer perform her tricks. The night before she's scheduled to be euthanized, the circus owner's 14-year old daughter, Dawn, sneaks Flora from the circus. All that stands between them and the safety of the elephant preserve is 200 kilometers of woods, one raging river, two elephant hunters, and the fear of not making it.

programme.title: Summerland
programme.desc: A reclusive Englishwoman opens her heart to a young evacuee as World War II rages across the channel.

programme.title: The Vow
programme.desc: Paige (Rachel McAdams) and Leo (Channing Tatum) are happily married newlyweds, but their idyllic life together suddenly shatters when a car accident leaves her in a coma. When Paige awakes, she has severe memory loss and doesn't know Leo. She also has a confusing relationship with her parents (Sam Neill, Jessica Lange) and still harbors feelings for a former fiance (Scott Speedman). Despite these difficult obstacles, Leo is determined to renew their bond and rebuild their marriage.

programme.title: Ferris Bueller's Day Off
programme.desc: Ferris Bueller (Matthew Broderick) has an uncanny skill at cutting classes and getting away with it. Intending to make one last duck-out before graduation, Ferris calls in sick, "borrows" a Ferrari, and embarks on a one-day journey through the streets of Chicago. On Ferris' trail is high school principal Rooney (Jeffrey Jones), determined to catch him in the act.

programme.title: Miles Ahead
programme.desc: In the 1970s, down-and-out jazz trumpeter Miles Davis (Don Cheadle) tries to recover his new session tape from music producers.

programme.title: Blithe Spirit
programme.desc: A married crime novelist finds himself in a tough predicament when an eccentric mystic summons the spirit of his first wife during a séance.

programme.title: The Vow
programme.desc: Paige (Rachel McAdams) and Leo (Channing Tatum) are happily married newlyweds, but their idyllic life together suddenly shatters when a car accident leaves her in a coma. When Paige awakes, she has severe memory loss and doesn't know Leo. She also has a confusing relationship with her parents (Sam Neill, Jessica Lange) and still harbors feelings for a former fiance (Scott Speedman). Despite these difficult obstacles, Leo is determined to renew their bond and rebuild their marriage.

programme.title: Ferris Bueller's Day Off
programme.desc: Ferris Bueller (Matthew Broderick) has an uncanny skill at cutting classes and getting away with it. Intending to make one last duck-out before graduation, Ferris calls in sick, "borrows" a Ferrari, and embarks on a one-day journey through the streets of Chicago. On Ferris' trail is high school principal Rooney (Jeffrey Jones), determined to catch him in the act.

programme.title: The Circus: Inside the Greatest Political Show on Earth
programme.desc: As President Biden travels to Brussels for an emergency NATO summit, "The Circus" examines Russia's threats of using nuclear weapons in its ongoing invasion of Ukraine and what the West is doing to prevent that catastrophic escalation (New!).

programme.title: Whiskey Tango Foxtrot
programme.desc: In 2002, cable news producer Kim Barker (Tina Fey) decides to shake up her routine by taking a daring new assignment in Kabul, Afghanistan. Dislodged from her comfortable American lifestyle, Barker finds herself in the middle of an out-of-control war zone. Luckily, she meets Tanya Vanderpoel (Margot Robbie), a fellow journalist who takes the shellshocked reporter under her wing. Amid the militants, warlords and nighttime partying, Barker discovers the key to becoming a successful correspondent.

programme.title: Mainstream
programme.desc: A young woman finds a path to internet stardom when she starts making videos with a charismatic stranger.

programme.title: Embattled
programme.desc: The eldest son of a ruthlessly tough MMA champion must fight his way out of the abusive cycle his father has continued.

programme.title: Billions
programme.desc: Chuck goes on a retreat to regroup; Prince looks to consolidate his wins; Wendy tries to figure out Prince's bigger picture; Sacker reckons with some old skeletons in her closet (New!).

programme.title: Super Pumped: The Battle for Uber
programme.desc: Travis finds himself on trial at Apple HQ, fighting for Uber's very existence; Arianna and Bill disagree on how best to steer Travis in the right direction; Emil has an illuminating conversation.

programme.title: First Reformed
programme.desc: The pastor of a small church in upstate New York spirals out of control after a soul-shaking encounter with an unstable environmental activist and his pregnant wife.

programme.title: Racing With the Moon
programme.desc: In their last weeks before deployment to World War II as Marines, teenage friends Henry Nash (Sean Penn) and Nicky (Nicolas Cage) try to make the best of the time they have left in their small California town. When Nash spots Caddie Winger (Elizabeth McGovern), a new girl in town he mistakenly believes to be wealthy, he sets about winning her over. But the good times are ruined when Nicky finds himself trying to solve a serious predicament, and implicating Nash and Caddie in the process.

programme.title: 7 Days in Entebbe
programme.desc: In July 1976, four terrorists hijack an Air France flight from Tel-Aviv to Paris and force the flight crew to land in Entebbe, Uganda. There, the Jewish passengers are held hostage, with their safety contingent on the release of dozens of terrorists jailed in Israel, Germany and Sweden. After considerable debate, the Israeli government employs the Israeli Defense Forces to execute a daring rescue.

programme.title: Dreamland
programme.desc: A teen bounty hunter is torn between helping or capturing a seductive fugitive bank robber hiding in his small town during the Great Depression.

programme.title: Old Henry
programme.desc: A quiet man and his son take in a wounded stranger near his homestead, along with a bag full of cash. The stranger claims he's a sheriff being pursued by outlaws, but the man can't be sure.

programme.title: The Mauritanian
programme.desc: A defense attorney, her associate and a military prosecutor uncover a far-reaching conspiracy while investigating the case of a suspected 9/11 terrorist imprisoned at Guantanamo Bay, Cuba, for six years.

programme.title: Queenpins
programme.desc: A frustrated suburban housewife and her best friend hatch an illegal coupon-club scheme that scams millions from corporations and delivers deals to legions of fellow coupon clippers. Hot on their trail is an unlikely duo -- a hapless loss-prevention officer and a determined U.S. postal inspector -- both looking to end their criminal enterprise.

programme.title: Flirting With Disaster
programme.desc: Adopted as a child, new father Mel Colpin (Ben Stiller) decides he cannot name his son until he knows his birth parents, and determines to make a cross-country quest to find them. Accompanied by his wife, Nancy (Patricia Arquette), and an inept yet gorgeous adoption agent, Tina (Tea Leoni), he departs on an epic road trip that quickly devolves into a farce of mistaken identities, wrong turns, and overzealous and love-struck ATF agents (Josh Brolin, Richard Jenkins).

programme.title: A Ghost Story
programme.desc: A passionate young couple, unexpectedly separated by a shocking loss, discover an eternal connection and a love that is infinite.

programme.title: Ghost
programme.desc: Sam Wheat (Patrick Swayze) is a banker, Molly Jensen (Demi Moore) is an artist, and the two are madly in love. However, when Sam is murdered by friend and corrupt business partner Carl Bruner (Tony Goldwyn) over a shady business deal, he is left to roam the earth as a powerless spirit. When he learns of Carl's betrayal, Sam must seek the help of psychic Oda Mae Brown (Whoopi Goldberg) to set things right and protect Molly from Carl and his goons.

programme.title: Dirty Dancing: Havana Nights
programme.desc: American high-school student Katey (Romola Garai) moves with her wealthy parents (Sela Ward, John Slattery) to Cuba in 1958. She encounters Javier (Diego Luna), a poor local who works as a waiter, and soon a relationship blossoms between them. At a nightclub, Javier teaches Katey the nuances of Cuban dance, which becomes her passion. As the young lovers grow closer, Fidel Castro suddenly rises to power. When her parents decide to flee to the United States, Katey must make a difficult choice.

programme.title: Queenpins
programme.desc: A frustrated suburban housewife and her best friend hatch an illegal coupon-club scheme that scams millions from corporations and delivers deals to legions of fellow coupon clippers. Hot on their trail is an unlikely duo -- a hapless loss-prevention officer and a determined U.S. postal inspector -- both looking to end their criminal enterprise.

programme.title: The Light of the Moon
programme.desc: Bonnie is a young New York architect whose life changes forever when a stranger rapes her in an alley. She receives loving and unwavering support from her boyfriend while trying to cope with the devastating effects of the attack.

programme.title: The Salzburg Connection
programme.desc: A U.S. lawyer (Barry Newman) joins Austrian intrigue over an old box containing names of Nazi collaborators.

programme.title: Hitman: Agent 47
programme.desc: Genetically engineered from conception to be the perfect killing machine, he's the culmination of decades of research, endowed with unprecedented strength, speed, stamina and intelligence. Known only as Agent 47 (Rupert Friend), his latest target is a corporation that plans to unlock the secret of his past to create an army of killers even more powerful than him. With help from a young woman, the elite assassin confronts revelations about his own origins in an epic battle with his deadliest foe.

programme.title: Proud Mary
programme.desc: Mary is a professional assassin who works for Benny, a ruthless gangster who heads an organized crime family in Boston. Her life gets completely turned around when she crosses paths with a 12-year-old boy named Danny during her latest hit. Mary's desire to save Danny from the streets and a sadistic drug dealer soon causes an all-out turf war that forces her to do what she does best -- and take down whoever stands in her way.

programme.title: Rogue
programme.desc: A battle-hardened mercenary leads a team of soldiers on a daring mission to rescue hostages in remote Africa.

programme.title: Deadpool
programme.desc: Wade Wilson (Ryan Reynolds) is a former Special Forces operative who now works as a mercenary. His world comes crashing down when evil scientist Ajax (Ed Skrein) tortures, disfigures and transforms him into Deadpool. The rogue experiment leaves Deadpool with accelerated healing powers and a twisted sense of humor. With help from mutant allies Colossus and Negasonic Teenage Warhead (Brianna Hildebrand), Deadpool uses his new skills to hunt down the man who nearly destroyed his life.

programme.title: Deadpool
programme.desc: Wade Wilson (Ryan Reynolds) is a former Special Forces operative who now works as a mercenary. His world comes crashing down when evil scientist Ajax (Ed Skrein) tortures, disfigures and transforms him into Deadpool. The rogue experiment leaves Deadpool with accelerated healing powers and a twisted sense of humor. With help from mutant allies Colossus and Negasonic Teenage Warhead (Brianna Hildebrand), Deadpool uses his new skills to hunt down the man who nearly destroyed his life.

programme.title: Rogue
programme.desc: A battle-hardened mercenary leads a team of soldiers on a daring mission to rescue hostages in remote Africa.

programme.title: Daybreakers
programme.desc: Ten years after a plague turns most of the world's population into vampires, a critical blood shortage causes panic and gruesome mutations among the reanimated. Edward (Ethan Hawke), a vampire hematologist, tries to develop a blood substitute when he meets Lionel (Willem Dafoe) and Audrey (Claudia Karvan), two fugitive humans who claim to have a possible cure. Edward casts his lot with them in the hope of perfecting the cure before it's too late.

programme.title: FXM Presents
programme.desc: An examination of the process of making movies follows a production from script to screen.

programme.title: All About Eve
programme.desc: Backstage story revolving around aspiring actress Eve Harrington. Tattered and forlorn, Eve shows up in the dressing room of Broadway mega-star Margo Channing, telling a melancholy life story to Margo and her friends. Margo takes Eve under her wing, and it appears that Eve is a conniver that uses Margo.

programme.title: Squad Car
programme.desc: An accused man (Don Marlowe) helps a policeman (Paul Bryar) investigate an airplane mechanic's death and a counterfeit racket.

programme.title: The Salzburg Connection
programme.desc: A U.S. lawyer (Barry Newman) joins Austrian intrigue over an old box containing names of Nazi collaborators.

programme.title: How to Steal a Million
programme.desc: Charles Bonnet (Hugh Griffith) expresses his passion for art by forging masterpieces -- and selling them at a hefty profit. The trouble starts when his reproduction of a prized sculpture winds up in a famous Paris museum. If experts determine that it is inauthentic, Bonnet's reputation will be tarnished. That's why his fetching daughter, Nicole (Audrey Hepburn), hires cat burglar Simon Dermott (Peter O'Toole) to steal the sculpture back before it's too late.

programme.title: Two for the Road
programme.desc: Architect Mark Wallace (Albert Finney) and his wife, Joanna (Audrey Hepburn), travel to France to meet with an affluent client (Claude Dauphin). While there, they reflect on their first decade of marriage -- memories of when they first met, of courtship and of road trips through the French countryside. As flirtation and playful quarreling turn to boredom with the banality of married life, the Wallaces struggle to rekindle their passion, while mutual infidelity threatens to tear them apart.

programme.title: All About Eve
programme.desc: Backstage story revolving around aspiring actress Eve Harrington. Tattered and forlorn, Eve shows up in the dressing room of Broadway mega-star Margo Channing, telling a melancholy life story to Margo and her friends. Margo takes Eve under her wing, and it appears that Eve is a conniver that uses Margo.

programme.title: On the Basis of Sex
programme.desc: Ruth Bader Ginsburg is a struggling attorney and new mother who faces adversity and numerous obstacles in her fight for equal rights. When Ruth takes on a groundbreaking tax case with her husband, attorney Martin Ginsburg, she knows it could change the direction of her career and the way the courts view gender discrimination.

programme.title: Lucy in the Sky
programme.desc: After an awe-inspiring experience in outer space, an astronaut returns to Earth and starts to lose touch with reality in a world that now seems too small.

programme.title: Mamma Mia! Here We Go Again
programme.desc: In 1979 young Donna, Tanya and Rosie graduate from Oxford University -- leaving Donna free to embark on a series of adventures throughout Europe. On her journeys, she makes the acquaintances of Harry, Bill and Sam -- the latter whom she falls in love with, but he's also the man who breaks her heart. In the present day, Donna's pregnant daughter, Sophie, dreams of renovating a taverna while reuniting with her mother's old friends and boyfriends on the Greek island of Kalokairi.

programme.title: Mamma Mia! Here We Go Again
programme.desc: In 1979 young Donna, Tanya and Rosie graduate from Oxford University -- leaving Donna free to embark on a series of adventures throughout Europe. On her journeys, she makes the acquaintances of Harry, Bill and Sam -- the latter whom she falls in love with, but he's also the man who breaks her heart. In the present day, Donna's pregnant daughter, Sophie, dreams of renovating a taverna while reuniting with her mother's old friends and boyfriends on the Greek island of Kalokairi.

programme.title: Lucy in the Sky
programme.desc: After an awe-inspiring experience in outer space, an astronaut returns to Earth and starts to lose touch with reality in a world that now seems too small.

programme.title: The Song of Bernadette
programme.desc: Based on the popular novel by Franz Werfel, this drama focuses on Bernadette Soubirous (Jennifer Jones), a young French woman who experiences vivid visions of the Virgin Mary. While many dismiss her claims, certain people, including the priest Dominique Peyramale (Charles Bickford), slowly begin to believe her. Eventually, Bernadette is deemed a saint, and becomes a nun at a convent, where she must deal with jealousy from others who resent her revered status.

programme.title: The Seven Year Itch
programme.desc: In the midst of a summer heat wave, New Yorker Richard Sherman (Tom Ewell) ships his wife, Helen (Evelyn Keyes), and their son off to Maine for vacation. Left alone to work back in Manhattan, Richard encounters a gorgeous blonde model (Marilyn Monroe) who has moved into the apartment upstairs, and becomes immediately infatuated. While pondering infidelity, Richard dreams of his beautiful new neighbor -- but will his fantasies about her become a reality?

programme.title: Caprice
programme.desc: An industrial spy (Doris Day) for a cosmetics firm falls for another (Richard Harris) who may not be on her side.

programme.title: The Quiller Memorandum
programme.desc: After two British Secret Intelligence Service agents are murdered at the hands of a cryptic neo-Nazi group known as Phoenix, the suave agent Quiller (George Segal) is sent to Berlin to investigate. There, he begins an affair with Inge Lindt (Senta Berger), a beautiful young teacher. However, their lives are put in danger after Quiller is kidnapped and taken to Phoenix's headquarters, where he meets Oktober (Max von Sydow), the mysterious leader of the group.

programme.title: In Like Flint
programme.desc: Former Z.O.W.I.E. spy Derek Flint (James Coburn) is called back from retirement after his former spy chief, Lloyd C. Cramden (Lee J. Cobb), is framed for prurient behavior with a prostitute, and U.S. President Trent (Andrew Duggan) experiences an incident of "lost time." After Flint discovers irregularities on a recently launched space-station mission, he realizes that an international conspiracy is afoot. He travels the world and assumes myriad disguises to unravel the nefarious plot.

programme.title: The French Connection
programme.desc: New York Detective "Popeye" Doyle (Gene Hackman) and his partner (Roy Scheider) chase a French heroin smuggler.

programme.title: The Intruder
programme.desc: Scott and Annie Russell couldn't be happier after buying their dream home from a mysterious and lonely widower named Charlie in Napa Valley, Calif. Their newfound paradise soon turns into a living nightmare when Charlie -- still strangely attached to the house -- begins to show up and interfere in their daily lives. When his erratic behavior turns to obsession, the young couple soon find themselves caught up in a violent confrontation that threatens to destroy everything they hold dear.

programme.title: Alien
programme.desc: In deep space, the crew of the commercial starship Nostromo is awakened from their cryo-sleep capsules halfway through their journey home to investigate a distress call from an alien vessel. The terror begins when the crew encounters a nest of eggs inside the alien ship. An organism from inside an egg leaps out and attaches itself to one of the crew, causing him to fall into a coma.

actor.role: Warrant Officer Lt. Ellen L. Ripley

programme.title: Aliens
programme.desc: After floating in space for 57 years, Lt. Ripley's (Sigourney Weaver) shuttle is found by a deep space salvage team. Upon arriving at LV-426, the marines find only one survivor, a nine year old girl named Newt (Carrie Henn). But even these battle-hardened marines with all the latest weaponry are no match for the hundreds of aliens that have invaded the colony.

programme.title: Alien Resurrection
programme.desc: Two hundred years have passed since Ellen Ripley (Sigourney Weaver) died on Fiorina 161. Aboard the medical research vessel USM Auriga, a team of scientists clone Ripley from her extracted DNA and removes the alien Queen embryo which was growing inside her at the time of her death.

programme.title: Alien Resurrection
programme.desc: Two hundred years have passed since Ellen Ripley (Sigourney Weaver) died on Fiorina 161. Aboard the medical research vessel USM Auriga, a team of scientists clone Ripley from her extracted DNA and removes the alien Queen embryo which was growing inside her at the time of her death.

programme.title: Ticking Clock
programme.desc: An investigative reporter (Cuba Gooding Jr.) finds the journal of a serial killer and traces it back to a 9-year-old orphan.

programme.title: Side Effects
programme.desc: For four years, Emily Taylor (Rooney Mara) has awaited the release of her husband, Martin (Channing Tatum), from being imprisoned for insider trading. Finally, Martin comes home, but Emily feels just as bad as she did when he was incarcerated, and she sinks into a deep depression. After her failed suicide attempt, psychiatrist Jonathan Banks (Jude Law) prescribes a series of medications. When those don't work, he gives Emily a new medication -- but the drug leads to ruined lives and death.

programme.title: Eat Pray Love
programme.desc: Liz Gilbert (Julia Roberts) thought she had everything she wanted in life: a home, a husband and a successful career. Now newly divorced and facing a turning point, she finds that she is confused about what is important to her. Daring to step out of her comfort zone, Liz embarks on a quest of self-discovery that takes her to Italy, India and Bali.

programme.title: Power Book IV: Force
programme.desc: Tommy and his crew can barely keep up with the demand and they need more help to increase their supply; More shocking details about Tommy's family surface, and he realizes the news could potentially affect his business (New!).

programme.title: Out of Sight
programme.desc: Meet Jack Foley (George Clooney), the most successful bank robber in the country. On the day he busts out of jail, he finds himself stealing something far more precious than money ... Karen Sisco's (Jennifer Lopez) heart. She's smart. She's sexy, and unfortunately for Jack, she's a Federal Marshal. Now, they're willing to risk it all to find out if there's more between them than just the law.

programme.title: Power Book IV: Force
programme.desc: Tommy and his crew can barely keep up with the demand and they need more help to increase their supply; More shocking details about Tommy's family surface, and he realizes the news could potentially affect his business (New!).

programme.title: Outlander
programme.desc: While visiting the Cherokee, Ian encounters a man from his past who dredges up painful memories of his time with the Mohawk; Jamie meets an Indian agent who challenges his convictions, causing him to reevaluate (New!).

programme.title: Iron Man 3
programme.desc: Plagued with worry and insomnia since saving New York from destruction, Tony Stark (Robert Downey Jr.), now, is more dependent on the suits that give him his Iron Man persona -- so much so that every aspect of his life is affected, including his relationship with Pepper (Gwyneth Paltrow). After a malevolent enemy known as the Mandarin (Ben Kingsley) reduces his personal world to rubble, Tony must rely solely on instinct and ingenuity to avenge his losses and protect the people he loves.

programme.title: Outlander
programme.desc: While visiting the Cherokee, Ian encounters a man from his past who dredges up painful memories of his time with the Mohawk; Jamie meets an Indian agent who challenges his convictions, causing him to reevaluate (New!).

programme.title: Power Book IV: Force
programme.desc: Tommy and his crew can barely keep up with the demand and they need more help to increase their supply; More shocking details about Tommy's family surface, and he realizes the news could potentially affect his business (New!).

programme.title: Sicario: Day of the Soldado
programme.desc: FBI agent Matt Graver calls on mysterious operative Alejandro Gillick when Mexican drug cartels start to smuggle terrorists across the U.S. border. The war escalates even further when Alejandro kidnaps a top kingpin's daughter to deliberately increase the tensions. When the young girl is seen as collateral damage, the two men will determine her fate as they question everything that they are fighting for.

programme.title: The Burnt Orange Heresy
programme.desc: Charismatic art critic James Figueras and his American lover travel to the lavish Lake Como estate of powerful art collector, Joseph Cassidy. Their host reveals he is the patron of Jerome Debney, the reclusive J.D. Salinger of the art world, and he has a simple request: for James to steal a Debney masterpiece from the artist's studio, whatever the cost.

programme.title: Saw II
programme.desc: On the hunt for the twisted vigilante and serial killer Jigsaw (Tobin Bell), Detective Eric Matthews (Donnie Wahlberg) and his team must apprehend the elusive murderer to rescue eight people trapped in an abandoned house, before they succumb to his torturous and murderous games. One twist to this task is that Matthews' own son, Daniel (Erik Knudsen), is among the eight people Jigsaw has chosen to test for their lack of morality. With nerve gas pumping through the house, every second counts.

programme.title: Curve
programme.desc: A young woman becomes trapped in her wrecked car after a hitchhiker causes an accident.

programme.title: Iron Man 3
programme.desc: Plagued with worry and insomnia since saving New York from destruction, Tony Stark (Robert Downey Jr.), now, is more dependent on the suits that give him his Iron Man persona -- so much so that every aspect of his life is affected, including his relationship with Pepper (Gwyneth Paltrow). After a malevolent enemy known as the Mandarin (Ben Kingsley) reduces his personal world to rubble, Tony must rely solely on instinct and ingenuity to avenge his losses and protect the people he loves.

programme.title: The Hurt Locker
programme.desc: Staff Sgt. William James (Jeremy Renner), Sgt. J.T. Sanborn (Anthony Mackie) and Specialist Owen Eldridge (Brian Geraghty) are members of a bomb-disposal unit in Baghdad. As their tour of duty enters its final weeks, the men face a set of increasingly hazardous situations, any of which could end their lives in an explosive instant.

programme.title: Outlander
programme.desc: While visiting the Cherokee, Ian encounters a man from his past who dredges up painful memories of his time with the Mohawk; Jamie meets an Indian agent who challenges his convictions, causing him to reevaluate (New!).

programme.title: All the King's Men
programme.desc: Charismatic Southern politician Willie Stark's (Sean Penn) idealism and good intentions give way to corruption after he becomes governor of Louisiana. Unfortunately for Stark, his right-hand man (Jude Law) retains the same good moral fibre he had when the men both entered the political arena.

programme.title: Iron Man 3
programme.desc: Plagued with worry and insomnia since saving New York from destruction, Tony Stark (Robert Downey Jr.), now, is more dependent on the suits that give him his Iron Man persona -- so much so that every aspect of his life is affected, including his relationship with Pepper (Gwyneth Paltrow). After a malevolent enemy known as the Mandarin (Ben Kingsley) reduces his personal world to rubble, Tony must rely solely on instinct and ingenuity to avenge his losses and protect the people he loves.

programme.title: Sicario: Day of the Soldado
programme.desc: FBI agent Matt Graver calls on mysterious operative Alejandro Gillick when Mexican drug cartels start to smuggle terrorists across the U.S. border. The war escalates even further when Alejandro kidnaps a top kingpin's daughter to deliberately increase the tensions. When the young girl is seen as collateral damage, the two men will determine her fate as they question everything that they are fighting for.

programme.title: 3 Days to Kill
programme.desc: Facing a terminal disease, spy Ethan Renner (Kevin Costner) has decided to give up his dangerous, high-stakes life in order to rebuild his relationship with his estranged wife and daughter (Hailee Steinfeld), whom he previously pushed away to keep them out of harm's way. However, in exchange for a potentially lifesaving drug, he must complete one final mission: apprehend one of the world's most ruthless terrorists while looking after his teenage offspring in her mother's absence.

programme.title: Robin Hood
programme.desc: After the death of Richard the Lion-Hearted, a skilled archer named Robin Longstride (Russell Crowe) travels to Nottingham, where villagers suffer under a despotic sheriff and crippling taxation. He meets and falls in love with a spirited widow, Marion (Cate Blanchett), although she is skeptical of his motives.
